messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] On a roll--What is a routine for	anunschooler? (very long)
messages.msgSnippet: Erin, This one I would bump up there. I really enjoyed and learned from it. I m not a quick reader but this one was fairly quick and did seem to move along
messages.messageBody:
Erin,
This one I would bump up there. I really enjoyed and learned from it.
I'm not a quick reader but this one was fairly quick and did seem to move
along well. I just wanted to second that recommendation. :-)

Barb E
"Ideas won't keep; something must be done about them."

- Alfred North Whitehead, Mathematician and philosopher





on 1/25/03 4:04 PM, Jim Selvage at jselvage@... wrote:

> Joyce,
>
> I will have to put that on my book list. The list is REALLY long at the
> moment, but I will get to it eventually.
>
> blessings,
> erin
>
>>> It is
>>> just different coming to this in the middle of the teen years and I am
>>> trying to figure out how to do it for us.
>>
>> A really good book is Parent/Teen Breakthrough: The Relationship Approach
> by
>> Mira Kirshenbaum. Basically the message is not to do anything that doesn't
>> enhance your relationship with your teen.
>>
>> Joyce

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] On a roll--What is a routine for anunschooler? (very long)
messages.msgSnippet: Joyce, I will have to put that on my book list.  The list is REALLY long at the moment, but I will get to it eventually. blessings, erin ... by
messages.messageBody:
Joyce,

I will have to put that on my book list. The list is REALLY long at the
moment, but I will get to it eventually.

blessings,
erin

> > It is
> > just different coming to this in the middle of the teen years and I am
> > trying to figure out how to do it for us.
>
> A really good book is Parent/Teen Breakthrough: The Relationship Approach
by
> Mira Kirshenbaum. Basically the message is not to do anything that doesn't
> enhance your relationship with your teen.
>
> Joyce
